UITSPRAAK

HOEXTER AR
Die vraag waaroor dit in hierdie app
l gaan, is die trefwydte van die bepalings van art 28(l)(g) van die Wet op Landdroshowe, nr 32 van 1944 ["die Wet"].

sections.facts: The appeal concerned the scope and applicability of the provisions of article 28(l)(g) of the Wet op Landdroshowe (the Land Drainage Act). Kleynhans sought clarification of the statutory language and its effect on the rights and obligations of the parties involved in land drainage matters.
sections.issues: The principal issue was whether the provisions of article 28(l)(g) of the Wet op Landdroshowe should be interpreted and applied in the manner asserted by the appellant, and what the correct extent of their legal force is.
sections.principles: The Court examined principles of statutory interpretation, including the purposive approach, the context of the legislation, and relevant precedents concerning the Wet op Landdroshowe. It considered how the courts have previously construed similar provisions in agricultural and land law statutes.
sections.application: Applying these interpretative rules, the Court evaluated the arguments presented by Kleynhans and Wessels, assessing the literal wording of article 28(l)(g) against the legislative intent and the practical implications for land drainage operations.
sections.conclusion: The Court delivered its judgment on the interpretation of article 28(l)(g), setting out the correct legal scope of the provision. (The detailed outcome is not provided in the excerpt.)
